H1144.def: = man (called {L:Ben-Oni<SDBH:בֶּן־אֹונִי>} by his mother), tribe, and territory; ◄ twelfth and last son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and second son of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H7782.def: = a musical instrument ◄ made from a ram's horn; ► sound is produced by blowing into the small end; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H4864.def: literally: lifting up; hence: = process by which humans are held responsible for a certain action or for the well-being of others

H1021.def: = town; ◄ territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>} or {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; close to {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>}

H6828.def: = a mountain, identified with Jebel ʾel-Aqraʿ ◄ in northern Syria, ► known by the Canaanites as the mountain of the gods

H7667.def: = causative action or process by which humans or deities cause an object to be broken into two or more pieces; ≈ sometimes use figuratively to denote the sudden end of a certain condition or situation

31.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H5000.def: = state in which humans or parts of their body are considered physically attractive

H1819.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6942.def: = action by which humans that are part of a {L:holy<SDBH:קָדֹושׁ>} nation set themselves apart from others by not engaging in activities that are not in accordance with God's law

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6153.def: = the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H759.def: = building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H5550.def: = earthen mound, cast up against the wall of a city ► in order to enable to enemy to scale the wall

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H2483.def: = state in which humans are lacking physical strength, ◄ as a result of sickness or injury

H4347.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

glosses: to be put out of joint
H3363.def: = process by which the position of a bone in its joint is disturbed, ► which results in the inability to use that bone properly

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1219.def: = action by which someone picks or harvests grapes from vines

H5552.def: = part of a tree which grows out from the trunk or a bough

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H5749.def: = action with which a person gives evidence or proof of something, often as a witness in a legal setting ► the witness can be favorable or unfavorable

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H3811.def: = action by which humans spend all their forces on a certain activity

H3557.def: = state in which a container is able to accomodate something within its available space

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H5475.def: = a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H4392.def: = state in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3828.def: = yellow or reddish gum produced by the Boswellia tree, a shrub that reaches 3 m high, with multiple trunks and small greenish or white flowers; the gum comes out in drops from the branches; ◄ Boswellia sacra; ► ingredient of the incense burned in the tabernacle

H7070.def: = a tall grass with stiff, sharply-pointed leaves and a plume-like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof-coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility

H394.def: = pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

H7355.def: = state in which humans feel affection for others

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H4032.def: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H2296.def: = state in which someone wears clothes or armor

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H6428.def: = action by which humans turn about in a substance, so that their body or clothing is covered by it

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H60.def: = a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H4553.def: = mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3173.def: = state in which humans are not part of a larger group or community

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H969.def: = person whose work is to analyze and determine the amount of metal in ore, or the amount of impurities in a precious metal; ≈ in a metaphorical sense, of someone who tests a person's or a people's behavior

H4013.def: = area that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H974.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of other humans or deities by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5637.def: = state by which humans or animals stand up to or oppose the authority of a person or ruler or deity

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5178.def: = a reddish-brown metal, ◄ mined from the hills, ► and used, together with {L:tin<SDBH:בְּדִיל>}, for the production of bronze

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H4647.def: = contraption, possibly consisting of two vertical cylinders covered with thick leather; the operator stood on top of these, pulling the leather up with an attached strap and then pressing it down with his foot to create the rush of air, which was channeled into a furnace in order to achieve the temperatures needed for the work

H5777.def: = a heavy bluish-grey soft metal, ≈ associated with heavy weight

H800.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H6884.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of humans by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
